security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and utility Python scripts for PyTorch Geometric. No network calls, no credential access, no obfuscation. Scripts only write to /tmp directory for data caching. Safe for distribution.

low_findings.title: Scripts write to /tmp directory
low_findings.description:
The Python scripts write data to /tmp directory for dataset caching and output files. This is standard practice for ML workloads but represents filesystem write access.

Example from benchmark_model.py:144:
`dataset = Planetoid(root=f'/tmp/{dataset_name}', name=dataset_name)`

content.user_title: Build Graph Neural Networks with PyTorch Geometric
content.value_statement: Graph Neural Networks enable learning from irregular data structures like social networks and molecules. PyTorch Geometric provides a comprehensive toolkit for building, training, and evaluating GNNs with minimal boilerplate code.
actual_capabilities: Implement GNN architectures including GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE
Load benchmark datasets for node and graph classification
Train models on citation networks, molecular graphs, and social networks
Apply graph transforms for preprocessing and augmentation
Generate boilerplate code for common GNN architectures
Visualize graph structures and compute network statistics
limitations: Requires PyTorch and torch_geometric libraries to be installed
Does not include pre-trained model weights
Limited to single-machine training (no distributed training examples)

best_practices: Start with GCNConv or GATConv for baseline models before exploring more complex architectures
Use NeighborLoader for large graphs to enable efficient mini-batch training
Apply transforms like NormalizeFeatures and AddSelfLoops during preprocessing for better results
anti_patterns: Using too many GNN layers without normalization (causes oversmoothing)
Training on the full graph without sampling for large datasets (memory issues)
Ignoring train/val/test split masks and using all labels for training

faq.question: What datasets are available for node classification?
faq.answer: Planetoid (Cora, CiteSeer, PubMed), Coauthor (CS, Physics), Amazon (Computers, Photo), and OGBN datasets.

faq.question: How many layers should my GNN have?
faq.answer: Most GNNs use 2-4 layers. Deeper networks risk oversmoothing. Use normalization and residual connections for deeper models.

faq.question: Can I use PyTorch Geometric with heterogeneous graphs?
faq.answer: Yes. Use HeteroData for multi-type node/edge graphs and to_hetero() to convert existing models.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. All scripts run locally and only access data you provide. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my model not training effectively?
faq.answer: Check: 1) correct train/val/test masks, 2) learning rate and weight decay, 3) sufficient epochs, 4) graph connectivity.

faq.question: How does PyTorch Geometric compare to other GNN libraries?
faq.answer: PyTorch Geometric offers the largest collection of GNN layers, transforms, and benchmark datasets with PyTorch integration.
